output.conclusion: By completing this course, you've gained a foundational understanding of Web3 governance and its importance. You are now equipped to participate in DAOs and contribute to the future of decentralized organizations.
output.introduction: Welcome to the world of Web3 Governance! This course will provide you with a beginner-friendly introduction to the concepts, tools, and practices used to govern decentralized organizations (DAOs) in the Web3 space. No prior experience is required!

chapters.description: A brief overview of Web3, its core principles (decentralization, transparency, immutability), and how it differs from Web2.
Understanding what Decentralized Autonomous Organizations (DAOs) are and their purpose.
Exploring the importance of governance in DAOs and the potential consequences of poor governance.
An overview of different governance models used in DAOs (e.g., token voting, quadratic voting).
Understanding how voting power is distributed and the role of tokens in governance.
Exploring the differences between on-chain and off-chain governance processes.
Understanding the process of submitting and discussing proposals within a DAO.
A step-by-step guide to participating in DAO voting.
How approved proposals are implemented and the role of smart contracts.
Exploring common challenges faced by DAOs, such as low voter turnout and Sybil attacks.
An introduction to popular tools and platforms used for DAO governance (e.g., Snapshot, Aragon).
A brief discussion on the future trends and potential evolution of Web3 governance.
